alert.note: Alert for North Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 5:44PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL ITASCA COUNTY THROUGH 615 PM CDT... At 544 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Inger, or 31 miles northwest of Grand Rapids, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Itasca County, including the following locations... Sand Lake, Jessie Lake, Spring Lake, Bowstring, Bowstring Lake and Talmoon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
